opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Potter,
This appeal involves precisely the same questions as those raised in the appeal in Atlantic Terra Cotta Company v. Carson, 248 Pa. 417. That decision necessarily determines this appeal.
The assignments of error are overruled, and the judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Potter,

attorneys: . Edward Hopkins on, Jr., and Abraham M. Beitler, with them A. 8. Ashbridge, Jr., for appellant.
John Mahn Thissell, with him J. Quincy Hunsicher and J. Quincy Hunsicher, Jr., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Powell v. Rogers, Appellant.
Argued Jan. 21, 1915.
March 8, 1915:
Appeal, No. 321, Jan. T., 1914, by defendant, from judgment of C. P. No. 2, Philadelphia Co., March T., 1912, No. 4294, M. L. D., for plaintiff for want of an affidavit of defense, in the case of Alfred £j. Powell v. Calvin W. Rogers, Owner or Reputed Owner, and Josephine L. Kennedy, Real Owner. Before Mestrezat, Potter, Elkin, Mosohzisker and. Frazer, JJ.
Affirmed.
. Edward Hopkins on, Jr., and Abraham M. Beitler, with them A. 8. Ashbridge, Jr., for appellant.
John Mahn Thissell, with him J. Quincy Hunsicher and J. Quincy Hunsicher, Jr., for appellee.
